reviews.sentence: Boutique hotel walking distance to be convention center 2 blocks from grocery store. Seems like an older well maintained hotel with a boutique renovation upgrade. It will meet your needs and compared to other nearby hotels it was well priced still pretty pricey though due to being in San DiegoIt had a smallish workout room with an elliptical and treadmill that is ok when alone but a bit snug with more than 2 3. The restaurant looked decent but I did not eat there. there is a full size grocery store 2 blocks away.

worst hotel. This hotel was the worst hotel I have been in. The hotel elevators were broke and at about 11 pm the ceiling of our room started leaking. A maintenance man was sent in and stayed there fixing the leak until midnight leaky ac. To top it off the ac was malfunctioning and when turned to cold the heat kicked on.
would not stay there again. They do not have a lot to offer beds not comfortable bathroom in need of new ceiling tiles and a good scrubbing of counter top. Would stay in a chain hotel.

Disappointed. Not sure how this hotel got a VIP rating but compared with others I have stayed at this was disappointing. Nothing big but all the little things added together. Even though there were 2 of us sharing we received 1 complementary welcome drink and 1 complementary bottle of water. Other VIP have always extended those small amenities. When the heat is our room stopped working on the second night and 2 service men failed to get it going again we were offered insultingly so in my opinion a complementary bottle of water for the inconvenience. Since changing rooms for the last night seemed pointless the offer to space heater was accepted but that died in the middle of the night. The mandatory VIP parking at 26 seemed pricy and the fire station across the street was very busy so lots of siren noise. Always be wary of hotels that do not post pictures of the bathroom although it was clean the utilitarian sink tapes and bent pipe faucet were amusing. Over all just a very disappointing stay Not very much Gas Lamp area is within walking distance but next time I had stay elsewhere Bathrooms need updating.

do nt understand pther revues. Location near has quarter was godstaf very helpful. Not a boutique hotel more like a business hotel. Found out paid same rate as grand Hyat on the beach. Decor in need of updating. Did not suit our purpose.

45 on it is way to a FIVE. I stayed here while on a business trip. The staff was extremely friendly starting with the front desk. Every encounter that I had with the staff was pleasant and I was very impressed. Though the stay was brief it was very nice and comfortable. The room was accommodating and had robes slippers and other items that I thought were a nice touch. I noticed there were ear plugs on the dresser but I did not realize why until 60 am came and I was awoken by the loud sounds of trucks rolling over the train tracks nearby. There was not much of a view but I did not come for the view so it was fine. The decor was okay but one of the most exciting things was that while I was staying here they were making plans for renovating the hotel. It sounded very exciting and I think I will return later to check it out. From this location I was able to walk to the gaslamp district as well as to seaport village. This hotel allows pets.

Quiet Hotel. A short walk from the train station. Rooms were large and the coffee in the room was great. Some floors being renovated but no noise at night. Beds comfortable and bathrooms a good size. Amenities good but a small fitness centre. Helpful staff.

Great location and Price. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Recently updated room except for the bathroom. They kinda skimped on the bathroom remodel. The shower water pressure was great though. They just opened their new gym which was awesome for a smaller exercise room with a city view. All Brand New Equipment with weights elliptical machines Treadmills medicine balls ketlebels etc. We had it all to ourselves. Overall our stay was great and close to everything good in downtown San Diego.

Good location. Great location easy walking distance to Gastown and with slightly longer walk Little Italy 92 bus to from airport just 12 block away. Staff pleasant to deal with. Free WiFi works well. Exercise room has very nice equipment but it needs maintenance mostly on the electronics and the motion and time sensor room light can go off unexpectedly at night leaving you exercising in the dark. No room fridge in our room not sure if this is the case for all rooms. Lots of street noise weekdays after 545am weekends a bit later. recommend trying to get a room facing away from 1st or C street andor on upper floor. They DO provide earplugs with the rooms. Memo to hotel management next time you renovate get double pane glass for the outdoor windows at least on lower floors. Yes you do not need it for energy saving reasons in San Diego but there is a big sound insulation difference. One block from shopping areas with Macys etc. A few more blocks to Gastown with lots of places to eat and real happy hour buzz mid to late afternoon.

Great room. Quick 1 night stay. newly refurbished room excellent very comfortable and quiet. Staff at front desk for check in very acomodating and willing to answer questions regarding the local area. Would certainly stay again.

Not sure why anyone would complain about street noise in a downtown metro area. The street noise was n’t even that bad. Even with the windows open and a construction site near by it was still pretty quiet and enjoyable. The new remodel is coming along great. I am a fan of the new decor. The staff was awesome room was clean and the shower was amazing. Some showers just suck but not this one. I will return.
A nice getaway to refresh. The staff was very helpful. All the construction around the hotel.

Stylish nice hotel but noisy area and crummy WiFi. The room itself is very updated contemporary and stylish. Bed was a bit soft for my taste and only had feather pillows which are n’t my favorite but I ’m sure many would find it perfectly comfortable. The bathroom had nice sized dedicated shower stall instead the typical bathtub shower combo. It seems like a recently updated bathroom. I was there for five days and the one piece of furniture I really missed was a set of drawers. Storage consisted entirely of a small closet which is fine for a couple days but drawers are nice when staying a bit longer unles you enjoy living out of your suitcase. I ’d have preferred some drawers instead of the massive 55 or 60 ” LED tv which I never used. Or put the tv on a stand with drawers instead the fancy but otherwise worthless stand it is on. WiFi was horrible constantly dropping out on all my devices iPhone iPad and Dell laptop. I ended using my cell phone for a wireless hotspot good thing I have an unlimited data plan because their WiFi was so useless. Worst part however was the noise. It ’s always a bad sign when you walk into your hotel room and there are two sets of earplugs by the bed. The hotel is located between a fire station on one side and a fire and rescue station on the other side. Plus every 20 30 minutes this horrible trolley sounds it ’s klaxon horns multiple times as it passes every nearby intersection. So between the sirens and the klaxons I got very little sleep. I ca n’t sleep with earplugs wedged into my ears all night —. that is way too painful so I just got awakened constantly. In summary as lovely as the room is decorated I would never stay in this hotel again. I would opt for one of the hotels down by the bay away from the fire stations and the god awful trolley which frankly was more obnoxious than the sirens.

Exceptional. Fresh refurbished bedrooms were very comfortable. All the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The complimentary breakfast was basic but nice however they finished serving at 9 am on weekdays which we found a bit too early.

Very Nice Great Locale. Upscale hotel with newly renovated rooms. Staff is very nice and welcoming. Easy custom coffee machine refilable water bottle stations and free breakfast. Walking distance to many sites. What more could you want.

Good choice. everything was fine but the rooms seem a little small or at least could use a little more storage area drawers especially. room and bath area were clean and house keeping totally refreshed the room for second day. near great restaurants right on trolley line blocks from the harbor.

The Bristol. Wow. Amazing property. I loved the modern decor and the welcoming staff. Our room was perfect with an amazing view 907The bed was plush and so cozy. The only complaint would be the restroom being so close to the bed and toilet placement. My husband and I stayed Friday to Sunday. This place is ideal for Gas Lamp shenanigans. Most people complain about the expensive parking but really this is the perfect location to walk mostly anywhere so normally I was freaked out about this fee since almost all the reviews complain about it. But TRUST me its worth it. Steps from Horton Plaza and a ton of good eats cheap and expensive alike. Cofe Cap Machine in the Lobby was awesome. I met one of the staff members asking about where to thrift in the area and she was AWESOME her name is Hope. She really needs a place at the front desk wink wink. We were with a group of people that were in and out and the Hotel was very accommodating to our event. My husbands Bike broke down and the parking attendants and maintenance staff were very helpful and even offered to help jump start his bike. After all the trips to the parts store to fix the dead battery we ended up staying there until 8 pm when check out was 11 am. The staff was very friendly during our crisis with the dead battery. I would stay here again with or without my kids.

Updated hotel in a great location. Great location friendly staff and nice accommodations. The rooms were updated and clean. Within walking distance to a lot of places such as Gaslamp and the waterfront. The breakfast is NOT free as the website had stated somewhere but the parking fees were accurate.
Exceptional. it was a very nice big renovated room with a big tv screen and big and very clean bathroom. Walk distance to the city center and beach.
